text: Data Privacy is about an individual's right to control their data.
In the cloud you can configure access settings for workloads that required different levels of accessibility,
from public websites to internal restricted content.
AWS has multiple services and features
that can help protect your data's privacy and integrity;
Amazon S3 is an object storage services that offers scalability, data availability, and security.
By default, all S3 buckets are private
and you should be careful when making changes to these default settings.
You can grant access by using access management features.
provides a client-side library for implementing encryption and decryption operations on all types of data.
DynamoDB Encryption Client provides a client-side library for encrypting data tables
before sending them to a database.
These services give you the power to protect your data and decide who has access.
To learn more go to aws.amazon.com/security.
